description.text: defaultAdminShell
A Part Type Information represents an item in the Catena-X Bill of Material (BOM) on a type level in a specific version.
Encapsulation for data related to the part type.

The single-level bill of material (BoM)represents one sub-level of an assembly and does not include any lower-level subassemblies. In the As-Planned lifecycle state all variants are covered ("120% BoM").
If multiple versions of child parts exist that can be assembled into the same parent part, all versions of the child part are included in the BoM.
If there are multiple suppliers for the same child part, each supplier has an entry for their child part in the BoM.
Set of child items in As-Planned lifecycle phase, of which the given parent object is assembled by (one structural level down).
Catena-X ID and meta data of the assembled child item.
Entity for common measurements of an item (mass, count, linear, area, volume, misc) with an unit and a value.
If a validity period only has a start that means that the period is valid from the start date without a (yet)defined enddate and vice versa.
Catena-X ID and meta data of the assembled child item.
Entity for common measurements of an item (mass, count, linear, area, volume, misc) with an unit and a value.
If a validity period only has a start that means that the period is valid from the start date without a (yet)defined enddate and vice versa.
Catena-X ID and meta data of the assembled child item.
Entity for common measurements of an item (mass, count, linear, area, volume, misc) with an unit and a value.
If a validity period only has a start that means that the period is valid from the start date without a (yet)defined enddate and vice versa.
Catena-X ID and meta data of the assembled child item.
Entity for common measurements of an item (mass, count, linear, area, volume, misc) with an unit and a value.
If a validity period only has a start that means that the period is valid from the start date without a (yet)defined enddate and vice versa.
Catena-X ID and meta data of the assembled child item.
Entity for common measurements of an item (mass, count, linear, area, volume, misc) with an unit and a value.
If a validity period only has a start that means that the period is valid from the start date without a (yet)defined enddate and vice versa.
Catena-X ID and meta data of the assembled child item.
Entity for common measurements of an item (mass, count, linear, area, volume, misc) with an unit and a value.
If a validity period only has a start that means that the period is valid from the start date without a (yet)defined enddate and vice versa.
Catena-X ID and meta data of the assembled child item.
Entity for common measurements of an item (mass, count, linear, area, volume, misc) with an unit and a value.
If a validity period only has a start that means that the period is valid from the start date without a (yet)defined enddate and vice versa.

displayName.text: Single Level Bill of Material as Planned

description.text:
The single-level bill of material (BoM)represents one sub-level of an assembly and does not include any lower-level subassemblies. In the As-Planned lifecycle state all variants are covered ("120% BoM").
If multiple versions of child parts exist that can be assembled into the same parent part, all versions of the child part are included in the BoM.
If there are multiple suppliers for the same child part, each supplier has an entry for their child part in the BoM.

preferredName.text: Single Level Bill of Material as Planned

definition.text:
The single-level bill of material (BoM)represents one sub-level of an assembly and does not include any lower-level subassemblies. In the As-Planned lifecycle state all variants are covered ("120% BoM").
If multiple versions of child parts exist that can be assembled into the same parent part, all versions of the child part are included in the BoM.
If there are multiple suppliers for the same child part, each supplier has an entry for their child part in the BoM.
The Catena-X ID of the given part (e.g. the component), valid for the Catena-X dataspace.
Timestamp when the relation between the parent part and the child part was created
The quantity value associated with the unit.
The unit of an item. Common units may be related to mass, count, linear, area, volume or misc.
Quantity of which the child part will be assembled into the parent part.
Timestamp when the relationship between parent part and child part was last modified.

The period of time during which the parent-child relation is valid. This relates to whether a child part can be built into the parent part at a given time.
If no validity period is given the relation is considered valid at any point in time.
The supplier of the given child item.
The Catena-X ID of the given part (e.g. the component), valid for the Catena-X dataspace.
Set of child items in As-Planned lifecycle phase, of which the given parent object is assembled by (one structural level down).
